channel.title: CNET News
channel.description: Tech news and business reports by CNET News. Focused on information technology, core topics include computers, hardware, software, networking, and Internet media.
channel.copyright: 2013 CBS Interactive Inc. All rights reserved

item.title: Apple WWDC predictions: Deutsche Bank chimes in
item.description: In a note to investors, the Deutsche Bank offers commentary on upcoming iOS changes. [Read more]
item.dc:creator: Brooke Crothers

item.title: E-Ink unveils Mobius flexible display for smartwatches
item.description: The 1.73-inch screen supports a resolution of 320X240 pixels with 16 greyscale levels. [Read more]
item.dc:creator: Steven Musil

item.title: Nvidia shows off software-based pressure sensitive display
item.description: It seems that you will no longer need a specialized stylus like the Galaxy Note 2's S Pen to etch out a sketch on your smartphone. [Read more]
item.dc:creator: Aloysius Low

item.title: iPhones can apparently be hacked with malicious charger
item.description: Security researchers come up with a way to use a battery charger to take over an iPhone in less than one minute. [Read more]
item.dc:creator: Dara Kerr

item.title: Future Windows 8.1 tablets to tap Qualcomm chip
item.description: Qualcomm's Snapdragon 800 silicon is expected to power upcoming Windows RT tablets. [Read more]
item.dc:creator: Brooke Crothers

item.title: Sean Parker agrees to $2.5M settlement over wedding venue
item.description: After constructing a massive venue in Big Sur's redwood forest without proper permits, Parker comes to an agreement with the California Coastal Commission. [Read more]
item.dc:creator: Dara Kerr

item.title: Is Grokr Apple's foray into predictive search?
item.description: To keep up with Google Now, Apple may be looking to boost its virtual assistant technology. [Read more]
item.dc:creator: Dara Kerr

item.title: Toshiba updates its laptop line for back-to-school
item.description: With new Intel chips right around the corner, look for updates and upgrades to these popular PC lines. [Read more]
item.dc:creator: Dan Ackerman

item.title: The Turkish revolution won't be televised, but it will be tweeted
item.description: As local news neglects the ongoing protests, Turkey's prime minister blasts Twitter as a "menace to society" for spreading information, or what he calls "lies." [Read more]
item.dc:creator: Dara Kerr

item.title: Troubleshooting Auto Save and Resume in OS X
item.description: Simple oversights as well as deeper problems may keep Auto Save and Resume from functioning properly. [Read more]
item.dc:creator: Topher Kessler

item.title: No Droid HTC One for Verizon? No big deal
item.description: The HTC One will arrive at Verizon months after it goes to other carriers, and Verizon won't carry the Droid sub-brand. That won't matter much at all. [Read more]
item.dc:creator: Scott Webster

item.title: The Yahoo e-mail privacy flap that wasn't
item.description: Why is the Internet so outraged about Yahoo scanning e-mail to improve the relevance of advertisements? This privacy flap already happened... in 2011. [Read more]
item.dc:creator: Declan McCullagh

item.title: Remember Napster? Rhapsody is refreshing Europe's memory
item.description: After buying the erstwhile pirate-music kingpin in 2011, Rhapsody International takes first major step with Napster and pushes it beyond U.K. and Germany to 14 new European countries [Read more]
item.dc:creator: Joan E. Solsman

item.title: Apple and DOJ's e-books court battle kicks off
item.description: At the start of the three-week trial, the DOJ argues Apple was the ringleader in the e-book pricing plan. Apple, meanwhile, says "this is a bizarre antitrust case." [Read more]
item.dc:creator: Josh Lowensohn

item.title: Analyst: Xbox One to cost $399, PlayStation 4 priced at $349
item.description: Wedbush Securities analyst Michael Pachter based his estimates, in part, on the cost of materials for the speculated specifications for each console. [Read more]
item.dc:creator: Jay Greene

item.title: App puts porn on Glass, Google vows to block it
item.description: Even the name of the app is not safe for work; Google says explicit content is not welcome on Glass. [Read more]
item.dc:creator: Eric Mack

item.title: Another cat accused of smuggling cell phone into jail
item.description: After a Brazilian cat was caught by security guards smuggling a cell phone and charger into a prison, authorities in Northern Russia say they've intercepted a similar feline felon. [Read more]
item.dc:creator: Chris Matyszczyk

item.title: In new S4 ad, Samsung replaces iPhone jokes with a fart joke
item.description: Samsung decides that for its latest Galaxy S4 ad, it's best to charm with babies and their noises and not bother with comparative humor. [Read more]
item.dc:creator: Chris Matyszczyk

item.title: The entire history of Windows in one video
item.description: Watch the entire string of upgrades from Windows 1.0 to Windows 8, as well as some gameplay from Reversi and Doom, in just over an hour. [Read more]
item.dc:creator: Eric Mack

item.title: Game mode on: CNET tests TVs for input lag
item.description: Input lag is a no-no for serious gamers who play shooters and other twitchy games. Find out which TVs lag behind the competition. [Read more]
item.dc:creator: David Katzmaier

item.title: Can Microsoft thrive if just 20 percent of devices run Windows?
item.description: Asymco's Horace Dediu says that just 20 percent of a rapidly expanding global market for computing devices will be a "viable" business for Microsoft. [Read more]
item.dc:creator: Dan Farber

item.title: Zynga cuts 520 workers and shutters several offices
item.description: The embattled social-games maker aims to cut up to $80 million in costs by culling employees across the company and closing offices in New York, Los Angeles, and Dallas. [Read more]
item.dc:creator: Joan E. Solsman

item.title: Android invasion on the PC
item.description: The Android operating system comes loaded on new computers from Asus and Acer, Apple gets closer to making iRadio a reality, and the Vine app swings over to Android. [Read more]
item.dc:creator: Bridget Carey

item.title: Atari dig aims to uncover infamous E.T. game cartridges
item.description: A film company plans to make a documentary about digging up the burial site of millions of unsold copies of Atari's E.T. game, one of the worst video games ever created. [Read more]
item.dc:creator: Amanda Kooser

item.title: Coming to Feedly reader: Speed, search, Windows 8 support
item.description: Developers of the service for reading RSS feeds are trying to rapidly add new features to please Google Reader refugees. Google's service shuts down July 1. [Read more]
item.dc:creator: Stephen Shankland
